newsitem.title: USA: Ticketmaster seeks to enjoin Microsoft.
newsitem.headline: Ticketmaster seeks to enjoin Microsoft.

text.p: Ticketmaster Group Inc said Tuesday it had filed suit against Microsoft Corp for allegedly using proprietary content from its Web site without permission.
Ticketmaster alleged that Microsoft was using the content to generate advertising revenue on its "Seattle Sidewalk" city guide service on the Microsoft network.

The lawsuit was filed Monday in the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California. It charged Microsoft wrongfully appropriated and misused Ticketmaster's name, trademarks and Web site and was publishing erroneous and misleading information. "Seattle Sidewalk" is one of many local guides Microsoft plans to publish around the country.
Earlier this month, Ticketmaster entered into an agreement tp provide online ticketing access and live event information to City Search, a competitor of Microsoft's "Sidewalk."
Ticketmaster sells 60 million tickets a year through more than 2,500 retail centers, 16 telephone centers, licensees, client box offices and its Internet site.
Microsoft was not immediately available for comment.
